intro: Securidaca complicata, commonly known as the African velvetbean, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, growing as a shrub or small tree. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
